msDesc.head: PETER OF POITIERS, SIMON OF TOURNAI; S. XII ex.

msItem.title: Three letters from the dean of Rouen to Archbishop Walter of Coutances (d. 1207), apprising him of the difficulties endured by his church during his absence and imploring his return
msItem.note: In an excellent French documentary hand of c. 1200
Across the head is ‘Questiones [erased] Et questiones magistri Simonis de Tornay’, in an early hand. At the head of fol. iv is a table of contents, s. xv; more text below this has been erased.

msItem.author: PETER OF POITIERS
msItem.title: Commentary on the Sentences
msItem.incipit: In deserto manna colligentes alius integrum gomor alius plus alius minor
msItem.explicit: mandata eius obserua; hoc est omnis homo.
msItem.finalRubric: (In a hand of s. xv, over erasure) Explicit summa beati Ancelmi super libros sententiarum. Deo gratias
msItem.note: Ed. P. S. Moore and M. Dulong, 2 vols (Notre Dame, Ind., 1943, 1950); Glorieux, Théol. 100b; Stegmüller, Sent. 679; many copies.

msItem.author: SIMON OF TOURNAI
msItem.title: Summa siue Institutiones in Sacra Pagina
msItem.rubric: Institutiones Simonis Tornacensis in sacram paginam.
msItem.incipit: Sicut legitur in ortographia d. littera media est inter th. aspiratum et t. lene
msItem.note: Extracts ed. M. Schmaus, RTAM4 (1932), 59–72, 187–98, 294–307, M.-T. d’Alverny, Alain de Lille. Textes inédits (Paris, 1965), pp. 305–12, W. Knoch, Die Einsetzung der Sakramente durch Christus. Eine Untersuchung zur Sakramententheologie der Frühscholastik von Anselm von Laon bis zu Wilhelm von Auxerre (BGPTM, Neue Folge, 24: Münster, 1983), pp. 298–303; R. Heinzmann, Die ‘Institutiones in Sacram Paginam’ des Simon von Tournai: Einleitung und Quaestionenverzeichnis (Munich, 1967), gives a complete list of quaestiones; the prol. ed. C. Marmo in CIMA 67 (1997), 93–103; Glorieux, Théol. 101a; 1768; Stegmüller, Bibl. 1768; Stegmüller, Sent. 818; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 618. One of six copies.

msItem.author: William de Thetford OP
msItem.title: Drafts of three letters
msItem.note: Written between 1239 and 1241/2 (a) to the abbot of St Benet’s Hulme; (b) to ‘Magister A. archidiaconus’ (Amaury of Buckden, archdeacon of Bedford, c. 1231–1245/6); (c) to R(obert Grosseteste), bishop of Lincoln.
Pr. K. W. Humphreys, ‘Three letters of William of Thetford, O. P.’, Jnl. of Eccl. Hist. 5 (1954), 201–6.

supportDesc.extent:
166 leaves (ii + 164) 350 220
230 140
Probably retrimmed at the head. Foliated in arabic numerals, s. xiv, as far as 56, repeating 3 and omitting 19.
supportDesc.collation: A singleton, 1–188, 194, 208, 218(8 canc.); the quires numbered at the end; catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 50 lines. Written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Small neat French early gothic bookhands.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 1 two large initials I in colours and gold, in ‘Channel style’ with beasts and a bearded man’s head; on fol. 105 a red and blue flourished initial; red or blue initials flourished in the other colour; marginal rubrication, especially in art. 2.

binding.p: Late medieval, repaired s. xix: chamfered oak boards with slightly projecting foredges, rebacked with brown pigskin; resewn on four bands; two straps from recesses in the front board to clasps at the back, all gone. Formerly chained from the foredge of the front board near the foot. Fols. i and 164 are paper blanks, s. xix.

history.provenance: Later at the Oxford Dominican convent: at the foot of fols. 109v, 110 and 113v are pencilled drafts of letters, written, between 1239 and 1241/2, from W. de Theford ‘fratrum predicatorum Oxonie’ (see above). The sender was William de Thetford OP (BRUO 1859), prior of the Oxford convent c. 1236, still in 1239.
On fol. iv‘liber collegii ex dono magistri Thome Bloxham’ and ‘B. lier8us’, in the usual hands (see above, MSS 60, 69). For Bloxham, see MS 41.
At the head of fol. 163v is ‘3usliber’, showing that it was in an electio.
On fol. iv is ‘O. 3. 4. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘L. 1. 4’ in red.
